channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: us
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: us

item.title: Andrew's royal exit is the latest crisis for Britain's monarchy
item.description: LONDON (AP) — Holding prestige but not power, Britain’s monarchy is finely tuned to public sentiment.
item.dc:creator: JILL LAWLESS, Associated Press, KTLA 5

item.title: Mexican Americans balance tradition and modernity in Day of the Dead celebrations
item.description: This weekend, Mexican American families across the U.S. will gather to honor their ancestors with altars, marigolds and sugar skulls on Dia de los Muertos — the Day of the Dead.
item.dc:creator: FERNANDA FIGUEROA, Associated Press, KTLA 5

item.title: Multiple people have been arrested in Michigan in a Halloween weekend attack plot, FBI director says
item.description: DEARBORN, Mich. (AP) — Multiple people who had been allegedly plotting a violent attack over the Halloween weekend were arrested Friday in Michigan, FBI Director Kash Patel said in a social media post. The law enforcement effort was focused on suburban Detroit.
item.dc:creator: MIKE HOUSEHOLDER and ERIC TUCKER, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Utah redistricting battle: Small city split into four congressional districts
item.description: The city's division means residents can cross different congressional districts simply by visiting nearby businesses.
item.dc:creator: Brian Entin, NewsNation

item.title: Monkey escape in Mississippi gives a glimpse into the secretive world of animal research
item.description: The recent escape of several research monkeys after the truck carrying them overturned on a Mississippi interstate is the latest glimpse into the secretive industry of animal research and the processes that allow key details of what happened to be kept from the public.
item.dc:creator: JEFF MARTIN, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Drug gang linked to murder of Colombian rapper, DJ
item.description: Mexican authorities are reporting the arrest of 16 people in connection to the murder of two Colombian artists last month.
item.dc:creator: Julian Resendiz, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Dad knifed on way to Halloween fest, kids save him from 'demonic stare' maniac with dino sticker, charger cord
item.description: A California father was stabbed multiple times during an unprovoked road rage attack while driving his children to a pumpkin patch in San Diego County.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Fox News True Crime Newsletter: Bryan Kohberger’s cash clash, Luigi Mangione's street cred, DC sniper's reveal
item.description: Stay up to date with the Fox News True Crime Newsletter, which brings you the latest cases ripped from the headlines, from crime to courts, legal and scandal.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Wisconsin becomes the 36th state to limit cellphones in schools
item.description: MADISON, Wis. (AP) — Wisconsin became the 36th state to limit cellphones and other electronic devices in school Friday, when its Democratic governor signed a bill requiring districts to prohibit phone use during class time.
item.dc:creator: SCOTT BAUER, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: South Carolina man chooses execution by firing squad despite concerns over last death by bullets
item.description: COLUMBIA, S.C. (AP) — A man on death row in South Carolina who taunted investigators with messages written with a victim's blood chose Friday to die by firing squad. Stephen Bryant, 44, will be the third man this year to die by South Carolina's newest execution method. His execution is set for Nov.
item.dc:creator: JEFFREY COLLINS, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Melodee Buzzard disappearance: FBI, detectives execute search warrants as 'at-risk' 9-year-old remains missing
item.description: The Santa Barbara County Sheriff's Office and the FBI conduct multiple search warrants as Melodee Buzzard, a nine-year-old California girl, remains missing.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Virginia teacher shot by 6-year-old student 'thought she was dead' as bodycam emerges
item.description: Virginia teacher Abby Zwerner testifies about being shot by 6-year-old student, telling court, 'I thought I was dead' as police footage reveals chaotic aftermath.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: With fragile Gaza ceasefire holding, Trump wants to make headway on Indonesia-Israel normalization
item.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — President Donald Trump made sure during his visit to Asia this week to praise regional allies who have backed his push to bring about a permanent end to the Israel-Hamas war.
item.dc:creator: AAMER MADHANI and EDNA TARIGAN, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Dallas-native pulls 1-of-1 Shohei Ohtani autograph on spontaneous card shop trip after father has a stroke
item.description: (WGN) — In the grand scheme of things, Rick Fayter and his son are a lot like other father-son duos across the country.
item.dc:creator: Eli Ong, WGN 9

item.title: 2 die in flooded New York City basements during heavy rainstorm
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Two people died in flooded New York City basements Thursday during a rainstorm that shut down roadways and caused airport delays, authorities said.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Tracking the storm: NYC flood warning, rain totals and wind gusts
item.description: NEW YORK CITY (PIX11) — A nasty storm is making its way through New York City. Flood warning NYC The National Weather Service issued a flood warning for Brooklyn, Manhattan, Queens and the Bronx Thursday afternoon through 5:30 p.m on Thursday.
item.dc:creator: Spencer Gustafson, NewsNation

item.title: Trump calls on Republicans to use 'nuclear option' and get rid of Senate filibuster
item.description: President Trump called on Senate Republicans on Thursday to initiate the "nuclear option" and get rid of the filibuster, which would allow them to end the government shutdown and pass legislation with a simple majority.
item.dc:creator: Brett Samuels, NewsNation

item.title: Extreme hurricanes have nearly doubled due to warming waters
item.description: Hurricane Melissa was one of the strongest hurricanes on record in the Atlantic. So is that proof that climate change is amplifying hurricanes? The short answer is no. Evidence of climate change requires a much longer record.
item.dc:creator: Jeff Berardelli, WFLA, NBC

item.title: National Guard in each state is ordered to create 'quick reaction forces' trained in civil unrest
item.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Military leaders have ordered the National Guard in every state to develop a “quick reaction force” of troops trained to deal with civil disturbances and riots that can be ready to deploy with just hours' notice, the latest indication of longer-term Trump administration plans to mo
item.dc:creator: KONSTANTIN TOROPIN, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: RFK Jr. says no 'sufficient' evidence Tylenol definitively causes autism
item.description: Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. said there is not “sufficient” evidence that Tylenol causes autism, softening warnings he and President Trump have repeatedly made to discourage the medicine's use by pregnant women and young children.
item.dc:creator: Nathaniel Weixel, NewsNation

item.title: See it: NYC streets submerged as torrential rain hits the city
item.description: NEW YORK (PIX11) -- Heavy rain has hit New York City, causing significant flooding across the boroughs. The National Weather Service issued a flood warning for Brooklyn, Manhattan, Queens, and the Bronx on Thursday afternoon through 5:30 p.m.
item.dc:creator: Video credit: Eileen Lehpamer, NewsNation

item.title: CBP seizes 166 exotic pets, including pythons and tarantulas, from car traveling to Mexico
item.description: A total of 166 reptiles and arthropods were identified within the vehicle, including dozens of pythons, numerous lizards, multiple frogs and several tarantulas.
item.dc:creator: Mia Morales, Fox 5

item.title: King Charles III strips Prince Andrew of titles and evicts him from royal residence
item.description: King Charles III is stripping his brother Prince Andrew of his remaining titles and evicting him from his royal residence, Buckingham Palace said Thursday.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, KRON4

item.title: Vance predicts holiday air travel will be 'a disaster' if shutdown does not end
item.description: Vice President Vance predicted Thursday that holiday air travel will be a “disaster” if the government shutdown does not end. “It could be a disaster,” Vance told reporters following a roundtable at the White House on how the shutdown is impacting airline travel.
item.dc:creator: Julia Manchester, WFLA, NBC

item.title: 5 more arrested as Louvre jewel heist investigation continues
item.description: The dragnet tightened around the Louvre thieves on Thursday. Five more people were seized in the crown-jewels heist — including a suspect tied by DNA — the Paris prosecutor said, widening the sweep across the capital and its suburbs.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, Fox 5

item.title: Trump appears to suggest the US will resume testing nuclear weapons for first time in 30 years
item.description: President Donald Trump appeared to suggest the U.S. will resume testing nuclear weapons for the first time in three decades, saying it would be on an “equal basis” with Russia and China.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Confirmation hearing for Casey Means, Trump's surgeon general nominee, delayed after she goes into labor
item.description: (The Hill) – The nomination hearing for Casey Means, President Trump’s nominee for surgeon general, in front of the Senate Health, Education, Labor and Pensions (HELP) Committee, has been postponed. A spokesperson for the committee, chaired by Sen. Bill Cassidy (R-La.
item.dc:creator: Max Rego, KRON4

item.title: The Latest: Trump says he has deals with China after meeting Xi to try to solve trade tensions
item.description: President Donald Trump said he's made deals with China after meeting Chinese leader Xi Jinping on Thursday, the final day of a trip to Asia that was an opportunity for the leaders of the world’s two largest economies to stabilize relations after months of turmoil over trade issues.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, KTLA 5

item.title: Trump, Xi agree to ease trade war in high-stakes meeting
item.description: President Donald Trump announced an agreement with Chinese President Xi Jinping to ease their trade war following a meeting Thursday, with the U.S. scaling back tariffs and China delaying export controls and resuming some soybean purchases.
item.dc:creator: Julia Manchester, Fox 5

item.title: California museum heist: Thieves steal over 1,000 items, including historical artifacts
item.description: The heist took place on the afternoon of October 15 at the Oakland Museum of California’s off-site storage facility, police said.
item.dc:creator: Amy Larson, WGN 9

item.title: Trump directs Pentagon to start testing nuclear weapons
item.description: President Trump said Wednesday that he has instructed the Defense Department to immediately begin testing U.S. nuclear weapons on an equal basis to China and Russia. “The United States has more Nuclear Weapons than any other country,” Trump wrote.
item.dc:creator: Filip Timotija, WGN 9

item.title: SF ranks as 4th 'rattiest' city in the US, according to annual rankings
item.description: For the first time in a decade, a new city has been named the 'rattiest' city in the country in Orkin's annual report of the most rodent-infested cities.
item.dc:creator: Spencer Kristensen, KRON4

item.title: Pulled pork sandwiches recalled over plastic contamination
item.description: The E.A. Sween Company announced this week that it is recalling a brand of its pulled pork sandwiches over concerns that there may be plastic pieces in them.
item.dc:creator: Jordan Perkins, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Hurricane Melissa expected to approach Bermuda today: NHC
item.description: TAMPA, Fla. (WFLA)— A Hurricane Warning is in effect for Bermuda as Hurricane Melissa is expected to approach the island later today and into tonight, the National Hurricane Center said.
item.dc:creator: Ashley Suter, WFLA, NBC

item.title: San Francisco mayor proposes denser housing to tackle affordability crisis
item.description: SAN FRANCISCO (AP) — San Francisco Mayor Daniel Lurie is trying to get more homes built for people like Liam Murphy: a fifth-generation city kid who found himself repeatedly outbid for tiny two-bedroom houses that wound up selling for $1.6 million.
item.dc:creator: JANIE HAR, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Hurricane Melissa leaves trail of destruction across Cuba, Haiti and Jamaica
item.description: SANTIAGO DE CUBA, Cuba (AP) — Hurricane Melissa left at least dozens dead and caused widespread destruction across Cuba, Haiti and Jamaica, where roofless homes, toppled utility poles and water-logged furniture dominated the landscape Wednesday.
item.dc:creator: ARIEL FERNÁNDEZ, ANDREA RODRÍGUEZ, JOHN MYERS JR. and EVENS SANON, Associated Press, KTLA 5

item.title: How Americans will be celebrating Halloween, according to a new AP-NORC poll
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Sherry Jenkins is a Halloween person by default. She lives in Blairstown, New Jersey, a rural town where much of the original “Friday the 13th” horror movie was filmed.
item.dc:creator: LEANNE ITALIE and LINLEY SANDERS, Associated Press, ABC 4
